title: Canadian Tire ordered to pay almost $1.3 million over ads
desc: Canadian Tire has been ordered to pay just under $1.3 million after pleading guilty to 74 counts of violating sections of Quebec’s Consumer Protection Act related to false advertising.

title: WHO says one person dead from Nipah virus in Bangladesh
desc: DHAKA: The World Health Organization said on Friday that a woman ​had died in northern Bangladesh in January after contracting the deadly Nipah virus infection. The case in Bangladesh, where Nipah cases are reported almost every year, follows two Nipah virus cases identified in neighboring India, which has already prompted stepped-up airport screenings across Asia. title: The Bull Case For JD.com (JD) Could Change Following Offshore Yuan Bonds And Global Logistics Push
desc: Recently, JD.com has reportedly explored issuing up to CN¥10 billion in offshore yuan "dim sum" bonds with maturities of up to 10 years, while simultaneously expanding its global logistics footprint through initiatives such as a new hub in Riyadh and the growth of its JD MALL concept in China. This combination of diversified funding plans and deeper logistics investment underlines how JD.com is attempting to reinforce its integrated ecosystem beyond its core domestic e-commerce base. title: Woman dead after car ploughs into house at Rivervale, Perth
desc: A woman has died after a car ploughed into a Perth home overnight, with the driver now in police custody.
